articles.title: An SSR Performance Showdown
articles.description: Fastify‚Äôs Matteo Collina set out to find the current state of server-side rendering performance across today‚Äôs most popular libraries. The first attempt faced negative feedback due to implementation issues, but the showdown has been improved and re-run.
articles.author: Matteo Collina

articles.title: Announcing Vue 3.5
articles.description: While v3.5 is a minor release, it‚Äôs one Vue users will love, with big performance and memory usage improvements in its reactivity system. With no breaking changes, upgrade and watch memory consumption drop.
articles.author: Evan You

articles.title: Reverse Engineering Minified JavaScript with ChatGPT
articles.description: Writing new code with AI is one thing, but could it be even better at understanding existing code that you‚Äôre struggling to grok? Yes, it seems.
articles.author: Frank Fiegel

articles.title: Inside ECMAScript: JavaScript Standards Get an Extra Stage
articles.description: After nine years of annual updates, TC39 has tweaked the process to make rolling out new features faster and smoother. The so-called ‚ÄòStage 2.7‚Äô has been around for a while, but this is a neat primer to what it represents.
articles.author: Mary Branscombe (The New Stack)

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Behind the Scenes: The Making of VS Code
articles.description: A detailed conversation with two of the popular editor's principal engineers on what makes it tick. VS Code is surely one of the world's most widely distributed JavaScript-powered apps.
articles.author: Holland, Rieken and Pasero (Microsoft)

articles.title: How I Created a 3.78MB Docker Image for a JavaScript Service
articles.description: The smallest JavaScript app container images tend to run into tens of megabytes, but tailoring your app to run on a lighter runtime like llrt can yield striking results.
articles.author: Shenzilong

articles.title: Exploring Goja: A Go-Powered JavaScript Runtime
articles.description: Goja is a pure Go(lang) JS runtime that makes it possible to embed JS into Go apps.
articles.author: JT Archie

articles.title: How to Use React Compiler
articles.description: The compiler feature in React 19 is generating a lot of buzz ‚Äî this ‚Äúcomplete guide‚Äù, as described by this author, covers much of what you'll need to get started.
articles.author: Tapas Adhikary

articles.title: Multithreaded Programming in Node.js using Atomics
articles.description: Worker threads enable you to write multi-threaded Node apps, but sharing resources across them can quickly become tricky. Atomics can help avoid some of the pain.
articles.author: Pavel Romanov

articles.title: jsdiff 6.0: A JavaScript Text Diffing Implementation
articles.description: Can compare strings for differences in various ways including creating patches. There‚Äôs an online demo. (Don't worry ‚Äì we're not going monthly ;-))
articles.author: Kevin Decker

articles.title: Redwood v8.0 Released
articles.description: A long standing, opinionated React & GraphQL (and/or RSC) full-stack framework that covers all the bases for professional dev teams with best-in-class tool support. v8.0 introduces a background jobs system, Docker support, and easier SSR and RSC setup.
articles.author: Redwood Team

articles.title: üá¨üáß¬†GOV.UK Vue 1.0: Build Vue Apps, the British Way
articles.description: The UK government is known for having an effective, well-designed site where Brits can complete various official tasks. Now you can get all of their components in Vue 3 form.
articles.author: UK Government

articles.title: üëÄ¬†style-observer: A Mutation Observer for CSS
articles.description: Attach JavaScript callbacks to changes in computed values of CSS properties.
articles.author: Bramus Van Damme

articles.title: Goxygen: Quickly Generate a Go Backend for a JS Project
articles.description: A tool that sets up a new Go-based project with Angular, React, or Vue in the front-end, and Docker and Docker Compose files to make it all work.
articles.author: Sasha Shpota

articles.title: Typist 7.0: Tiptap-Based Rich Text Editor Component
articles.description: Simple and opinionated. You can try several examples in the sidebar. Well suited for basic rich text situations like writing comments or messages and has a single-line mode.
articles.author: Doist

articles.title: Belt: A New Tool for Starting React Native Apps
articles.description: A CLI tool for starting a new React Native app that takes various mundane decisions away from you and uses tooling and conventions established by a productive app development team.
articles.author: Thoughtbot

articles.description: ‚≠ê Vercel goes deep into what's new in React 19.
üí∞ Alpine.js creator Caleb Porzio shares his tale of passing $1m on GitHub Sponsors.
Bye NgModules, the future of Angular is standalone! Angular v19 will make standalone: true the default for components, directives, and pipes. This is already the recommended best practice, however.
Angular's product lead, Minko Gechev, has also shared a little about what it means to mange the Angular project.
OpenAI has switched ChatGPT from Next.js to a Remix-based app, according to Remix's Ryan Florence on X.
üáµüá± Poland's WarsawJS community is holding a 10th anniversary meetup on September 11. They invite you to ‚ñ∂Ô∏è watch live on YouTube.
ü§ñ Lee Robinson shows off ‚ñ∂Ô∏è the latest enhancements to Vercel's v0, an AI-based tool for creating apps and components from prompts you supply.
Node.js v22.8.0 (Current) ‚Äì Adds a new API for enabling on-disk code caching at runtime, as well as options to set thresholds for code coverage success.
Astro 4.15 ‚Äì The popular content site framework stabilizes Astro Actions, a solution for fully type-safe backend functions.
Jimp 1.3 ‚Äì Pure JS image processing library for Node.
Turborepo 2.1, Puppeteer 23.3, Mermaid 11.1

articles.title: The Secret Inside One Million Checkboxes
articles.description: One Million Checkboxes is/was a site with one million global checkboxes on it where checking (or unchecking) a box changed it for everyone on the site, instantly. This fun post-mortem digs into how the internet (and, specifically, a group of smart teenagers) played with the project to reach ends you'd never expect..
articles.author: Nolen

articles.title: The Ultimate Guide to Font Performance Optimization
articles.description: This is quite the rabbit hole indeed, but a useful one to go down if your site is using custom fonts and you‚Äôre serving them up directly yourself. Of course, step one is to consider sticking to system/web-safe fonts.. ;-)
articles.author: Anna Monus (DebugBear)

articles.title: Supporting AVIF in Google Search
articles.description: Image format AVIF is now a supported file type in Google Search and Google Images, as well as any place that uses images in Google Search.
articles.author: John Mueller (Google)

articles.title: The Web Design Museum: The First Decade of Web Design
articles.description: Exhibits thousands of unique old website designs from the early 90s to mid-00s. A fun way to discover forgotten trends in web design.
articles.author: Web Design Museum

articles.title: Apple 'Appears to Mislead' UK Regulator Over Deceptive Default Browser User Interface
articles.description: Looks like Apple is claiming that a previously implemented pattern for picking default browsers in iOS, in fact, never even existed. üòµ‚Äçüí´
articles.author: Open Web Advocacy

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Caching Demystified: Inspect, Clear, and Disable Caches
articles.description: Dives into the different types of browser cache and how to inspect and manage them in Chrome DevTools.
articles.author: Jecelyn Yeen

articles.title: Finding Two Lines of CSS That Tanked Performance
articles.description: Upon launching the Learn Web Components site, Andrico discovered one of its animations caused a sharp drop in performance on Firefox. Here‚Äôs what he discovered and how he fixed it.
articles.author: Andrico Karoulla

articles.title: Lazy Loading Isn't Just Lazy, It's Late: We Can Do Better
articles.description: ‚ÄúWe tend only to fetch more content as the user scrolls it into view or navigates to the next page, which isn‚Äôt just lazy: it‚Äôs often late and an awful user experience‚Äù. This post suggests a more proactive approach.
articles.author: Jupiter Jayna

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Scroll-Enhanced Experiences
articles.description: A 52-minute journey through the art of 'scrollytelling' with CSS, guiding you through the process of creating dynamic experiences that leverage a user‚Äôs scroll behavior. Covers controlling pace/rhythm of a page with the CSS Scroll Timeline API.
articles.author: Carmen Ansio

articles.title: 'Why I Don‚Äôt Block AI Scrapers'
articles.description: ‚Äúlet thieves do thief things until our justice system(s) do justice system things‚Äù.
articles.author: Jens Oliver Meiert

articles.title: Reasonable Colors: An Open-Source Color System for Building Beautiful, Accessible Color Palettes
articles.description: Just drop in the base stylesheet, then use the provided CSS variables that provide built-in ‚Äúshades‚Äù for each color.
articles.author: matthew howell

articles.title: Introducing style-observer, A MutationObserver for CSS
articles.description: Bramus has created a MutationObserver for CSS. It, dubbed style-observer, allows you to attach JavaScript callbacks to changes in computed values of CSS properties.
articles.author: Bramus Van Damme

articles.title: The Dev Tools Performance Monitor Panel
articles.description: In Chrome, if you open 'Dev Tools > More Tools > Performance Monitor' you‚Äôll see some helpful high-level charts and graphs of the realtime performance data of your UI.
articles.author: Dave Rupert

articles.title: Avatars: A Collection of Diverse Free Avatar Images
articles.description: Downloadable in PNG format, but also accessible directly via a public CDN and there‚Äôs a Figma plugin available.
articles.author: alohe

articles.title: Tailwind Grid Builder: Learn and Build CSS Grids with Tailwind
articles.description: A simple tool to generate the HTML with Tailwind classes for a custom grid. Just select number of items, rows, columns, and number of breakpoints as needed. Useful also for learning the Tailwind class names.
articles.author: Tailscan

articles.title: Button Stealer: A Chrome Extension That "Steals" a Button from Every Website You Open
articles.description: A funny way of 'collecting' an inspiration gallery of buttons, which the author has done and you can view here.
articles.author: anatoly zenkov
